Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Interface TaskErrorHandler

public interface TaskErrorHandler
Defines a callback notified whenever a failure occurs while trying to create or execute a task node. This callback can be specified for a TaskGraphBuilder or a TaskGraphExecutor.

Thread safety

The method of this interface is expected to be safely callable by multiple threads concurrently. The method should have no expectation on the thread and context from which the callback is called.

Synchronization transparency

The method of this interface is not expected to be completely synchronization transparent. However, the callback must be aware that it can be called from many context. Callers of the callback must not hold locks while calling the callback.
See Also:
  • TaskGraphBuilderProperties.getNodeCreateErrorHandler()
  • TaskGraphExecutorProperties.getComputeErrorHandler()

    void
    onError(TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey, Throwable error)
    Called whenever a failure occurs while trying to create or execute a task node.

  • Method Details

    • onError

      void onError(TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey, Throwable error)
      Called whenever a failure occurs while trying to create or execute a task node. This method has the responsibility of logging the error. If it fails to do so, the actual error will not visible to the outside world (though its implications are detectable).
      Parameters:
      nodeKey - the TaskNodeKey identifying the node associated with the failure. This argument cannot be null.
      error - the error causing the failure of the node creation. This argument cannot be null.
